job.name: Emotion_Detection_In_Bing_Images
job.description: Emotion Detection workflow searches for images of a person using Azure Bing Image Search then performs an emotion detection using Azure Emotion API.

task.name: BingImageSearch
Split
task.description: This task defines some input, here strings to be processed.

script.code:
print(variables.get("BING_IMAGE_SEARCH_OUTPUT")) OUTPUT_DATA=variables.get("BING_IMAGE_SEARCH_OUTPUT")["value"] urls=[] for document in OUTPUT_DATA: image_url=str('{0}'.format(document["contentUrl"])) print(image_url) urls.append(image_url)
result=urls print(result) #print("image_urls= ", image_urls)

task.name: Merge
task.description: As a merge operation, we simply print the results from previous tasks.

script.code:
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import copy
print("results=",results) print("values=",results[0].value().decode("utf-8")) merged_html=BeautifulSoup(str(results[0].value().decode("utf-8") )) print('len==',len(results)) i=0 for html in results: if i==0: i=i+1 continue i=i+1 soup = BeautifulSoup(html.value()) print('***************') print('BODY==',soup) for element in soup.body: print('element=====',element) merged_html.body.append(copy.copy(element))
result=str(merged_html).encode('utf-8') resultMetadata.put("file.extension", ".html") resultMetadata.put("file.name", "result.html") resultMetadata.put("content.type", "text/html")

task.name: Emotion_API
task.description: Welcome to the Microsoft Emotion API, which allows you to build more personalized apps with Microsoft as cutting edge cloud-based emotion recognition algorithm. https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/emotion/
